p: Moreover, water balance achieved by the absorption of water and transpiration from cut flowers is an essential factor that affects cut flower's quality and vase life ( Da Silva, 2003). So, the cut flower is subjected to water deficit when transpiration is higher than water uptake, resulting in the flower's wilting ( Halevy and Mayak, 1981). The inability to absorb water is one of the causes of wilting, which may result from the growth of the microorganisms in the stem's cambial tissues ( He etÂ al., 2006).
